gFeCvigXGR29pFCFpRSmAg.text: Oh my, I used to go there before. Perfect places to drink, talk and study. The background also very good. I really like the shop assistant, she is so friendly. The cheese very yummy. Long time no go there, I think I will ask my friends to go there again.

cLT2-_cI_CJGkgfR_NuWIA.text: Most fun coffee shop in the world!  There are obviously less expensive more tasty coffee options around but where else can you drink your face off?  Literally. You go in, pay 5-7 bucks, order a Cold Coffee (hot doesn't work so they warn you), then you take a selfie.  The outcome is your selfie in the actual drink!  Not on some plastic lid but actually in your coffee.  What voodoo is this?  The coffee itself was just ok. I've had coffee all over the world so I'm a bougie snob but who knew my face would taste so damn just Ok!  One of those places in the world you must come once, take a picture/video, lick your face, then call it a day.  Tip: Please don't BATHE in cologne or perfume.  Seating is very limited, cramped, and itimate.  Don't be that guy who smells and over compensates with scented oils or whatever the heck that was.

W7Kd1KcPxTt1hXwuW4XSUg.text: People love taking selfies AND drinking coffee so why not put the two together? And so Selfie Coffee was born!Located on Haji Lane, Selfie Coffee definitely fits the hipster bill of the area - besides the hashtag in the name, the cute nature-print theme of the outside continues inside and upstairs where there are many spots for photo opportunities and that perfect Instagram pic. Surprisingly when we came on a Saturday morning there were no other customers so we had the top level and our choice of the upstairs seating to ourselves. While they offer both hot and cold drinks as well as desserts, the main attraction is the selfie coffee. You can only do the selfie coffee with the cold drinks, so we went for a basic iced Americano. They have you use a provided phone to take a selfie on the spot to print onto your drink, then give you a buzzer so you can wait outside or upstairs. When it was ready (voila!), our photo was presented on top of a thick layer of foam/cream...until we poked our straws through our faces, that is! It's a cool concept and a fun thing to try with friends or your significant other. The coffee was also not bad. Good for the novelty and the selfie aspect definitely draws you in, but for the price, a return visit is probably not necessary (especially since the woman who served us was not particularly friendly either...).

photos.caption: Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Punctured our faces!
Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Americano
Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Upstairs area

isxhtMsNJFMkANibaIvvSg.text: we order hazelnut frappe and it tastes ok not too sweet. we had to take our own picture with their iphone.  the tran family was here. tourist trap. it's cost $8.90 and no coffee taste.

photos.caption: Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. selfie coffee

3TVdhdIqS0nEwuKTkhRJ_g.text: How cool is this??? How awesome to see your selfie picture on top of a cup of coffee? I absolutely love this shop. Too awesome and cute to miss when visiting Singapore. This shop is located on a long street full of bars and souvenir shops. There is so much to see here. The walls on the building has lots of cool graffiti artworks to take pictures too. This shop is very small but it have two floors. A must stop for all tourists when visiting in Singapore.

nCuA9jbOdXC1XMfl0JRmlg.text: Great coffee. Costs ~S$8.50 for an Americano with a selfie on it. Open WiFi available.

geglcvm_I-Rl9u5Rph2qZA.text: Coffee? Good by my standards, although the layer of foam was a little thick for me.Ambience? Great! Love the picture frames and forest theme on the second floor. Remember that they do not have toilet paper or soap in the restroom so be prepared with some sanitizer!Price? Little pricey at around $10 per item, but they include the picture printed on your coffee & compared to American branded coffee sold in Singapore (Starbucks, Peets) it seemed pretty reasonable.Location? Cool alleyway, a little difficult to find the place unless you're actively looking for it though.Overall? I thought it was great, but really a one time thing. Nothing really calls me to return unless one of my friends wants to try it. Super cool idea though & I'll be sure to tell my friends to visit if they're ever in town!

photos.caption: Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Get a Polaroid of your selfie printed out for an additional $1.50!

EUkum_RTef5RaAYay1HfVQ.text: Yes, this is a thing.We now live in a world where you can take a selife, have it printed on coffee foam and presented to you in about 10 minutes or so. And yes, the selfie foam is edible! I have no idea how they do it, but it never fails to impress me. I've only had the iced/frappe styles, but each time I thought they tasted pretty good.However, I have to deduct 2 stars because of their bathroom situation. I noticed there was no toilet paper left so I went down and alerted them, only for the employee to say: "Oh, we don't supply toilet paper."So... you're not going to even try to remedy the situation? I just found it a bit odd, considering they charge over $8 for these coffees, they're running their AC at a comfortable temperature, and they probably pay heaps of rent as they're on popular Haji Lane. There are no excuses for not having toilet paper on the premises.Thank goodness for 7-Eleven next door, which had tissues I could buy. Because when you desperately have to take the Browns to the Super Bowl, you'll do whatever it takes! (Yes, I went there.)

photos.caption: Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Me and Miguel M's #selfie coffee

NBxRiPwruzzBwH6Qbe6C5g.text: Gimmicky!!! But perfect for selfie whores, I mean, fanatics! At $8, you can have your selfie 'imprinted' onto your coffee. Yup. That's right. It's organic and safe and void of coloring, they claim. And you know what, mine was an iced signature coffee (without sugar syrup upon my request), the coffee wasn't half bad. Rather good actually!! I genuinely poking a straw through my face (nose to be more exact) and sipping the coffee, and watching my selfie sink and warp in my cup. Hahahahaha!Novelty but at least the coffee was better than Starbucks!

photos.caption: Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. I pierced my nose

4_T-baWN3HzDveXjDIkUQA.text: Hot and cold drinks, desserts and savory pies. A bit expensive and slow to make on the "selfies" drinks but fun! Drinks with selfies on the surface of your drink, what a concept.

photos.caption: Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Menu wall
Photo of #Selfie Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Grand opening

xAJlwT5RgYC0sb0cxNEesg.text: A very cute two story café with a nice ambience. First of all, why people come here? To have their face printed on a drink. I must admit I'm one of them. But it is a very unique experience that ill remember- drinking myself. I ordered a honey milk which is nice! ( I like honey and milk) The most unique drink experience ever (But quite a one time experience for me)If you have not been there before, I recommend trying it for yourself!!!Honey milk- 7/10

IzG2zgnk9QETY38qRA2Hsw.text: Cute little café with a really cool and probably ridiculous twist. I only tried their salted caramel cake as I was in the area and hankering for something sweet. But it was really nice!! Not gonna lie though, I'd like to go back and get my face on a coffee. Just cause. Also eat more cake.
